intro: Leiothylax sessilis, commonly known as the sessile leiothylax, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture. The flowers are usually pink or purple, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat.
